meanings.definition: In a way that is possible to imagine or believe.
meanings.sent1: She could conceivably finish her homework before dinner.
meanings.sent2: It is conceivably going to rain later today.
meanings.sent3: Conceivably, the cat could learn to play the piano.
meanings.sent4: The idea of time travel is conceivably mind-boggling.
meanings.sent5: The thought of winning the lottery is conceivably exciting.

meanings.definition: In a way that is within the realm of possibility.
meanings.sent1: He could conceivably become a famous actor one day.
meanings.sent2: It is conceivably safe to swim in the lake.
meanings.sent3: Conceivably, pigs could fly if they had wings.
meanings.sent4: The concept of teleportation is conceivably fascinating.
meanings.sent5: The dream of traveling to space is conceivably achievable.
